trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Envoy | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Envoy | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Envoy with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Envoy with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Envoy.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Envoy.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Envoy tenant
trans-unit.target: A Envoy tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Envoy will be able to single sign into the application at your Envoy company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Envoy will be able to single sign into the application at your Envoy company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Envoy
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Envoy

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Envoy.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Envoy.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Envoy.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Envoy.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Envoy, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Envoy, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Envoy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Envoy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Envoy with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Envoy with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Envoy requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Envoy requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Envoy application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Envoy application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Envoy page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Envoy page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Envoy Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Envoy.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Envoy Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.Envoy.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Envoy page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Envoy.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Envoy page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Envoy.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Envoy company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Envoy company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Envoy</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Envoy</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Company.
trans-unit.target: Click Company.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Company</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Company</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SAML.
trans-unit.target: Click SAML.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Authentication configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Authentication configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The value for the HQ location ID is auto generated by the application.
trans-unit.target: The value for the HQ location ID is auto generated by the application.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Envoy dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider HTTP SAML URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Envoy dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider HTTP SAML URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Envoy.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Envoy.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Envoy using the access panel, Envoy checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Envoy using the access panel, Envoy checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Envoy.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Envoy.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Envoy **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Envoy **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
